variable.name: b.prog.prof
question.text:
How would you describe your proficiency with programming, relative to a typical undergraduate student?

Consider a 'typical' student to mean a current UCSB undergraduate from any major and any class standing.

variable.name: b.prog.comf
question.text: Regardless of your skill level, how would you describe your comfort level with programming?

variable.name: b.math.prof
question.text:
How would you describe your proficiency with mathematics, relative to a typical undergraduate student?

Consider a 'typical' student to mean a current UCSB undergraduate from any major and any class standing.

variable.name: b.math.comf
question.text: Regardless of your skill level, how would you describe your comfort with mathematics?

variable.name: b.stat.prof
question.text:
How would you describe your proficiency with statistics and probability, relative to a typical undergraduate student?

Consider a 'typical' student to mean a current UCSB undergraduate from any major and any class standing.

variable.name: b.stat.comf
question.text: Regardless of your skill level, how would you describe your comfort with statistics and probability?

variable.name: b.updv.num
variable.description: approximate number of upper division courses in math/stat/programming
question.text: All together, about how many upper-division UCSB courses (or transferrable equivalents) have you taken in one of the above areas (statistics and probability, mathematics, and programming)?

variable.name: b.updv.clas
variable.description: specific courses taken, selected from prespecified list
question.text:
Which of the following classes have you completed? Please select all that apply.

For series (e.g. PSTAT120A-B), select the option if you have taken any course in the series. 

Please do not include courses in progress.

variable.name: b.dom
question.text:
Do you have any domain specialization (e.g., biology, linguistics, environmental science, physics, etc.)?

Consider specialization to mean upper-division coursework or equivalent experience in any field.

variable.name: b.dom.txt
question.text: If yes, in what domain?

variable.name: b.dsrsrch
variable.description: research experience in data science, yes/no
question.text: Not including class projects or personal projects, do you have any experience doing supervised research activity involving data science?

variable.name: b.dsrsrch.txt
variable.description: comment on research experience in data science
question.text: If yes, please elaborate in a few words....22

variable.name: b.othrsrch
question.text: Not including class projects or personal projects, do you have any experience doing supervised research activity not involving data science?

variable.name: b.othrsrch.txt
question.text: If yes, please elaborate in a few words....24

variable.name: b.consent
variable.description: consent to share responses on preparation and experience
question.text: Are you okay with your responses in this section being shared, separate from your identity and personal information, to other students enrolled in PSTAT197A?

variable.name: pr.projtype
variable.description: preference for industry or lab project
question.text: Do you have any preference regarding working on an industry project or lab project?

variable.name: pr.lang
question.text: Would you prefer to work in a specific programming language for the project?

variable.name: pr.dom
question.text: Which of the following domains interest you? Check all that apply.

variable.name: pr.area
variable.description: areas of interest in data science
question.text: Which of the following areas of data science interest you? Check all that apply.

variable.name: pr.goals.txt
question.text: What do you most hope to get out of the capstone project?

variable.name: pr.comment.txt
question.text: Is there anything else you'd like taken into account in your project team placement?

variable.name: pr.consent
variable.description: consent to share responses on project preferences
question.text: Are you okay with your responses in this section being shared, separately from your identity and personal information, with other students in PSTAT197A ?

variable.name: b.rsrch
question.text: derived from b.dsrsrch and b.othrsrch
